metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Devella Fountainhead at Elfsong Tavern. This dialog only can be played once. After dialog, Devella will go away.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Go near Devella (S_LOW_Devella_Fountainhead_048defbd-d386-4272-a5b7-40c1a9e75b81), she will spot players.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: I know a lot about Bhaal. I suspect he's involved with this.

276.speaker: Player
276.text: I know a lot about Bhaal. I suspect he's involved with this.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I found another murder victim. Absolute symbol nearby, just like Stelmane.

180.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
180.text: Another? Whoever's behind this is certainly effective, and I've no more Fists to spare. Tell me you've found something else that could actually help us?

161.speaker: Player
161.text: I found this bottle of wine - it's poisonous.

121.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
121.text: Hmm. That tracks. The killer paralyses the victim with poison. And wine is a perfectly innocuous vessel for it.

115.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
115.text: But that doesn't get us any closer to motive.

242.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
242.text: Nor does it tie this back to the Bhaalist resurgence.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: Remind me what I'm looking for?

194.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
194.text: Something, anything that can link these murders to the Bhaalist resurgence.

200.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
200.text: The key to solving a murder is to understand the motive. The ritualistic nature of these killings point to the Absolute, but I don't buy it. It's too convenient.

148.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
148.text: I'll see what else I can find here, but keep your eye out in the city. There'll be more corpses soon, if we can't figure this out.

123.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
123.text: Get back to it, then. Lives depend on it. Literally.

135.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
135.text: What? I've got a duke's murder to solve, and not a lot of time to do it.

164.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
164.text: Oh bollocks - I told those idiots not to let anyone through.

117.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
117.text: YOU. Name, rank, and reason for interrupting an active crime scene. For your sake, the last one better be bloody good.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Are you Devella? Valeria sent me.

233.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
233.text: To fetch her another bottle of mead, no doubt.
233.context: NodeContext: muttered darkly under her breath

173.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
173.text: Yes, I'm Devella, the unfortunate colleague.

289.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
289.text: Unless you've got useful information, leave me to my work. Duke Stelmane's dead - and I've got to find who killed her.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I know more about Bhaal than anyone you'll find. You don't want to send me away.

258.speaker: Player
258.text: Valeria said you might want to see this. Show her the murder target list.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: Useful information like this? Show her the murder target list.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: Tell her about the murder target list you found.

91.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
91.text: Gods - that's it! Proof that I was right.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Was it an aspiring Bhaal cultist by any chance?

124.speaker: Player
124.text: There's more at stake than Stelmane's murder now that Bhaal himself is involved.

62.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
62.text: Bhaal? That's exactly what I - wait. How do you know about that?
62.context: NodeContext: with the realisation that her improbable conclusion/investigation was bang on the money but also still suspicious of the player (how do THEY know?!)

256.speaker: Player
256.text: Don't panic, but I'm sort of... his spawn.

219.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
219.text: Oh! Oh my. By Ilmater's rack, that's... that's...

281.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
281.text: I should arrest you at once, but - well, the Bhaalspawn crisis, it's the most interesting criminal plight in Baldurian history.

102.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
102.text: If what you claim is true, you wouldn't be helping me here unless you were trying to end Bhaal's hold over you.

268.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
268.text: Just like the wayward Bhaalspawn who saved the Gate before...

255.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
255.text: You are here to help me, and not to sacrifice me, aren't you?

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You're very excited about Bhaal for someone who's supposed to be protecting the city.

144.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
144.text: It's my job to be. Though I confess it has been very interesting.

153.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
153.text: You see, these murders have been cropping up all over the city. I've been following their trail for a while now, and tracing it back to its roots.

84.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
84.text: The ritualistic brutality of them... it's extraordinary. And it could only be the work of a Bhaalist.

2.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
2.text: But you've been investigating too, if I'm not mistaken? You're trying to stop your own kind?

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I am working against Bhaal - I got a hold of the list of murder targets.

253.speaker: Player
253.text: I'm working against Bhaal - I found the murderer's target list.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Tell her of the target list. Say nothing of your intentions.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Show her the target list. Say nothing of your intentions.

284.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
284.text: I'm glad you're on the right side of this, Bhaalspawn. You could be invaluable, if you can get on the inside.

225.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
225.text: Hells, you might be the only one who can stop this. What else do you know?

247.speaker: Player
247.text: I was hoping you could tell me more.

59.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
59.text: Most of what I know is based on reading into Sarevok's history. I'm sure it's nothing next to your personal experience, but I'll share what I have.

140.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
140.text: A century ago, Bhaal bred dozens just like you. One of whom was Sarevok Anchev.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: I'm planning to infiltrate the cult, but I don't know where to start.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Bhaal is trying to force me to be his Chosen. I'm doing all I can to resist him.

271.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
271.text: So it's all happening again... just like in Sarevok's time...

277.speaker: Player
277.text: Father has shown me visions - the Temple of Bhaal lurks somewhere in the city.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: I don't know much. I only just found out I was a Bhaalspawn in a vision.

51.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
51.text: You've had a busy tenday. I can't even imagine. Well, I'll tell you what I know.

182.speaker: Player
182.text: I am here to sacrifice you, I'm afraid.

21.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
21.text: Ah, hells. I will live to warn the Gate. FISTS!

261.speaker: Player
261.text: Recount your investigation into Father Lorgan's murder, and what you remember of the list you found.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Tell her about the murder target list you found.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Show her the list of murder targets.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: Recount your investigation into Father Lorgan's murder, and show her the list you found.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Tell her about the murder target list you found while investigating Lorgan's murder.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: Never mind me - how do you know about Bhaal's resurgence?

105.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
105.text: It's becoming something of an obsession of mine. You see, these murders have been cropping up all over the city.

221.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
221.text: They're always the same - victim paralysed by poison, Absolutist symbol scrawled on the floor in blood. Hand removed pre-mortem.

252.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
252.text: And the removal of the hand pre-mortem... the unnecessary brutality of it - it's got to be connected to Bhaal, it's just got to be.

6.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
6.text: Now your turn. What do you know about this?

226.speaker: Player
226.text: I was just fearmongering for fun. Bhaal's not back. Everything is fine.

20.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
20.text: You're a terrible liar. You've got something. Give it here.

236.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
236.text: Gods... This is it. The proof that I was right!
236.context: CinematicNodeContext: Devella takes and studies the list

96.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
96.text: I've been working on an assignment, see - a research project of sorts. I knew my conclusions were sound, but this... I never expected this.

210.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
210.text: I'll tell you what I know.

167.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
167.text: A century ago, there was a man - Sarevok Anchev. He was a child of the god of murder, Bhaal.

243.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
243.text: He ruled the Iron Throne - a dark tower hiding a darker secret. It was the front for a deadly arms-dealing network.

71.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
71.text: There, Sarevok amassed an army and sought to become a god. Under his stewardship, the Bhaal Temple was revived, and with it, the Bhaal cult itself.

0.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
0.text: Fortunately, the Temple was destroyed, and to cleanse the city of Sarevok's memory, the Iron Throne was torn from its foundations and cast into the Chionthar.

31.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
31.text: For most, that was the end of it. But cults like that don't disappear overnight. This list you brought me confirms I'm right.

119.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
119.text: The Bhaal cult is back, and someone is out there, continuing Sarevok's work.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: Bhaal has a new Chosen in Baldur's Gate - Orin. I suspect she's behind this.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: What makes you think it's not Sarevok himself?

28.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
28.text: I've not ruled out the possibility that it is Sarevok himself.

201.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
201.text: The brutality of the killings is certainly reminiscent of his work. But there's something more here, something new...

216.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
216.text: There's a reverence to these murders, a certain flair. It's as if they were done in worship.

130.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
130.text: The precision of the cuts, the depth, the execution - the best butchers in Faerûn couldn't make a cut like that. Trust me, I've asked them.

107.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
107.text: I tried to explain all this to my superiors, but they wouldn't have any of it.

126.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
126.text: They told me to drop it. Told me the city doesn't need another conspiracy theorist and to get back to doing my job before they find someone else to do it for me.

159.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
159.text: But you - you're not bound by such constraints. Help me out, here. Help the city out.

213.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
213.text: Follow the trail of these murders. Prove the truth. Use your lineage to get places the Fist can't.

111.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
111.text: I'll bet if you follow the trail of these murders, you'll be able to unearth the truth of this resurgence.

181.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
181.text: Believe me, I wish I could. But I need this job.

197.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
197.text: Half the silkroot-chewers in the Gate have claimed to be a Bhaalspawn at one point. The Fist don't listen to ghost stories.

188.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
188.text: You're better off not raising any suspicions. Trust me.

208.speaker: Player
208.text: What will you do in the meantime?

1.speaker: Player
1.text: What about the other victims on the list, the ones who are still alive?

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I'm going to stop my Father, whatever it takes.

199.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
199.text: If anyone can, it will be you. Or at least that's what the legends say.

254.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
254.text: But before you run off, do you think you could save a few more lives?

217.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
217.text: You really are a godsend. But - one more thing...

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I'm trying to hide from my Father's wrath. I fear what will happen if I delve too deeply.

110.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
110.text: Then I hope you can at least protect yourself, and pray this plot fails.

137.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
137.text: But before you run and hide, there are a few more lives you could easily save.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: I've got better things to do than investigate a cult.

17.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
17.text: I suppose it was quite an ask... but perhaps you wouldn't mind doing me a different, smaller favour?

120.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
120.text: There are patriars on the murder target list. I'm oathbound to secure them first, so I'll be heading to the Upper City next.

37.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
37.text: While I'm there, the other potential victims will be at risk. Could you warn them?

195.speaker: Player
195.text: The Flaming Fist should be protecting everyone - not just Upper City folk.

109.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
109.text: Not from around here, are you? We're in Baldur's Gate - this is just how things work.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: I'll see what I can do.

283.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
283.text: Thank you. That's all I can ask, and more than I hoped.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Isn't it enough that I already agreed to investigate the murder trail?

234.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
234.text: You seemed capable - it would have been remiss of me not to ask. But I understand.

162.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
162.text: Once I'm done with the patriars, I'll head to Basilisk Gate to have another go at convincing my superiors to put some resources into this matter.

230.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
230.text: Meet me there if you've anything more to report. And good luck.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: That's your job. Not my problem if you only want to help the rich.

57.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
57.text: You don't seem to understand - my job is to help the rich first.

274.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
274.text: But fine, if you're not interested in helping, I guess I'll just have to try and convince my superiors to put some resources into this matter.

99.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
99.text: Once I've secured the patriars, I'll head to Basilisk Gate. Meet me there if you have a change of heart.

100.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
100.text: The people of the Gate are fortunate another of Bhaal's children stands against him. Walk in light.

248.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
248.text: I've done everything I can within the remit of my job. Any more, and they'll fire me.

229.speaker: Player
229.text: I think it may be a Bhaalspawn...

192.speaker: Player
192.text: I think it may be another Bhaalspawn...

178.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
178.text: Gods save us all if you're right, but I'd believe it. Whoever it is, they are intimately familiar with Sarevok's work.

152.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
152.text: No idea, unfortunately. But whoever it is, they are intimately familiar with Sarevok's work.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: You said Sarevok led the cultists a century ago - he can't still be alive, can he?

151.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
151.text: Stranger things have come back to haunt this city.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: You're absolutely right. I have reasons of my own to think there's been an increase in Bhaalist activity.

47.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
47.text: Good. Then your eyes are open to the truth.

290.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
290.text: The brutality of the killings is on a par with Sarevok's own. But there's something more here, something new...

147.speaker: Player
147.text: You're not wrong about the cult. I found some Bhaalists in the sewers.

98.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
98.text: No doubt you found a trail of bodies in their wake?

196.speaker: Player
196.text: Not only is the cult back, it's spreading fast. I ran into some Bhaalists in the park.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: You should raise this with your superiors, immediately.

241.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
241.text: Don't you think I've tried? They won't listen.

127.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
127.text: You're lucky you met me - most of the Fist wouldn't have believed you were a Bhaalspawn. Think it's Baldurian superstition.

72.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
72.text: For most, that was the end of it. But cults like that don't disappear overnight. That list you spoke of confirms I'm right.

155.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
155.text: You're a terrible liar. Tell me everything - now.

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *Begrudgingly, you tell her about the murder target list you found.*

136.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
136.text: Ah, another sceptic. You should consider joining the Fist. You'll find plenty of like-minded folks.

177.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
177.text: Now if you don't mind, I've work to do.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: It's simple really. I kill you, as an offering to Bhaal.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Because I am going to kill you now - in his unholy name.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Let me help you - I trained under Camber Fosrick, the world's greatest investigative mind.

222.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
222.text: Nice try. That name's straight out of those dreadful Cormyr detective stories. Get lost - I've work to do.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Do you need some help? I've dealt with much worse than this.

77.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
77.text: Suppose it couldn't hurt - we're scraping the barrel as is right now.

67.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
67.text: Look, kid. I can see you mean well. But I'm not letting a civilian get involved.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Use the crime scene to describe how Stelmane was killed. Show her you can help solve this.

55.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
55.text: Very nice. Correct on most counts - you might prove useful.

75.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
75.text: Here's all I've found. The duke was paralysed by poison, Absolutist symbol scrawled on the floor in blood. Hand removed pre-mortem.

69.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
69.text: The symbol's the bit that bothers most. You use poison when you want to get away with murder. So why leave a symbol at the scene of the crime? It doesn't make any sense.

65.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
65.text: And the removal of the hand... I've a theory, but - well, you're a civilian. That one will be for me to follow up.

112.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
112.text: Oh, you saw? I suppose there's no harm in sharing it with you. It's just a theory, after all...

43.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
43.text: I've been working on an assignment - a side-project of sorts. I think the removal of the hand is the key, but I just can't figure out how.

41.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
41.text: Corpses without hands are showing up all over the city. Together with dioramas of death and murder. It has to be connected.

215.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
215.text: The brutality of it, the unnecessary brutality... My theory is that it's got something to do with the Lord of Murder himself - Bhaal.

53.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
53.text: The higher-ups don't want to hear that, of course. The last thing they need is public hysteria about a cult that was supposed to have died out over a century ago.

125.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
125.text: I'd follow up myself, but while this uniform gets me into certain places, it keeps me out of others. Especially places that don't want to be found...

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I need to look into the Bhaalists, and fast. I think they're after me.

141.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
141.text: Perfect. Unofficially, mind. As far as the higher-ups are concerned, you're still just a civilian. If you end up breaking any laws, well - I won't be able to help you.

12.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
12.text: Report back to me if you find anything. And thank you. If I'm right, you'll be doing a great service to the city.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: I understand. I'll look into this Bhaalist resurgence for you.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Take the uniform off, then. Go undercover.

86.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
86.text: Oh believe me, I wish I could. But that's above my paygrade. Besides, someone's got to oversee the investigation here.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: I can't help you. I've got business of my own.

183.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
183.text: Everyone does in this city. All right, but keep your eyes peeled, and your mouth shut. If you find anything, tell me, but best not to go alarming the other Fists.

272.speaker: Player
272.text: Lucky you! The future Chosen of Bhaal stands before you, and you will be their offering!

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Tell me your theory. Perhaps I can help.

34.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
34.text: It's nice of you to indulge me, but I'm afraid this matter is a little too sensitive to share as a mere indulgence.

263.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
263.text: Thank you for your interest, citizen, but I'd best get back to doing the real work. Alone.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: Try to read her body language.

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *She's not just reticent to share her theory - she's hiding a physical object. A document of some sort.*

118.speaker: Narrator
118.text: *She's tense, that much is clear to see. But her professional veneer is simply too resistant to amateur probing.*

214.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
214.text: Look, I'd love to stand around and chat, but there's work to be done.

260.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
260.text: If you find something, let me know. But don't get your hopes up. I certainly won't.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I'll see what I can find.

138.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
138.text: Don't get your hopes up, but do report back if you find something. The people of Baldur's Gate will be grateful for a breakthrough in this case.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I'll leave you to your work.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: I've seen my share of dead bodies. Maybe I can be of help?

238.speaker: Player
238.text: I have seen death and cruelty in all its forms. Perhaps I could be of service?

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I am no stranger to hunting down vicious killers - be they man or beast. Perhaps I could help?

246.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
246.text: Of course. You're a civilian. You shouldn't be involved in this.

223.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
223.text: An adventurer. Fantastic. We don't have enough of those in Baldur's Gate.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Uh, [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], recently unemployed, I quite like murders?

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Erm. [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], amnesiac, I care about preventing murders?

156.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
156.text: A hobbyist detective? I can't fault the drive - I read the Baldur's Mouth crime reports like a starving wereboar before I worked for the Fist.

265.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
265.text: But you should leave it to the professionals. It's not healthy for civilians to see scenes of such a sensitive nature.

227.speaker: Player
227.text: I'm no one - just another adventurer.

270.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
270.text: I'm chasing down a serial killer who seems to kill without motive. You try doing that and staying calm.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: You're doing a grand job. I hope the person who solves your murder will be just as diligent.
143.context: NodeContext: she realises the player is threatening to kill her

171.speaker: Player
171.text: I'm lost. I'll leave you alone.

286.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
286.text: I thought I made myself very clear, civilian. Move along.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: I know a lot about Bhaal. I suspect he's involved with this.

249.speaker: Player
249.text: I know a lot about Bhaal. I suspect he's involved with this.

235.speaker: Player
235.text: You're going to want to see this. Show her the murder target list.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Tell her about the target list.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Are you sure I can't help?

92.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
92.text: Sure as the stench of an ogre's latrine. Get lost.
